sentences.sContent: He gets frustrated when people don’t understand what he’s trying to say.
sentences.sCn: 人们不懂他在说什么时，他就会很懊丧。

sentences.sContent: The government has deliberately frustrated his efforts to gain work permits for his foreign staff.
sentences.sCn: 政府蓄意挫败了他为其外国员工取得工作许可证的努力。

trans.tranOther: someone who wants to develop a particular skill but has not been able to do this

trans.tranCn: 挫败；阻挠（frustrate的过去式和过去分词形式）
trans.tranOther: If someone or something frustrates a plan or attempt to do something, they prevent it from succeeding
